website_summaries.verdict: This is a very affordable transfer bench, but some assembly is required. We like its stability on uneven surfaces and its reversible left/right orientation.
cons: Some concerns about parts breaking unexpectedly

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this, poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Chair broke after six weeks of use. I am physically disabled and when I was getting out of the tub, the chair broke. I was very lucky that I wasn't injured. Don't buy this chair.
customer_reviews.author: S. Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Minimize the chance of that slip and fall in your bathtub
customer_reviews.text: My elderly Mother figured out a way to fall backwards down her basement stairwell, cracking a whole bunch of bones in the process. Needless to say, as feisty as she is, her balance and mobility are not quite what they were before the accident. This bench is awesome because it allows her to seat her self at the outside edge of her bathtub and then swing herself in where she can operate a hand shower wand to bath herself. It is both sturdy and stable. Now there is no need for her to stand in a bath tub that is taunting her to take a slip and fall.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan F

customer_reviews.title: I had trouble keeping the water in the shower until ...
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble keeping the water in the shower until we cut two slits in the shower curtain so that the curtain can cover both ends of the tub and be folded under where the seat is.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pieces missing. Very inconvienent
customer_reviews.text: I almost never write reviews but this situation is different. I ordered this product for a client. It came on time but when I opened the box it appeared as if someone had just taken a handful of screws, washers, and other hardware and just threw them into the box as an afterthought!. Of course the quantities were way off. Meanwhile there was someone depending on me to furnish this item today. I had to buy another and wait for it. Definitely not this brand! I will never buy this brand again!
customer_reviews.author: Dena Vettor

customer_reviews.title: Not worth any amount of money!
customer_reviews.text: AW-FUL!!!! I've purchased many items from Amazon that I've been very satisfied with. Unfortunately this ISN'T one of them! I bought this bench for my husband who is going thru cancer treatments and is having nerve problems in his legs. I thought getting a shower bench would be helpful but I'm afraid to have him use it. It's not stable or safe. Instructions would have been so helpful had they been included!! Just 12 pieces and a baggie full of nuts and bolts. I had to watch online videos of similar products to assemble. They used wing nuts. Wish THIS one did. Not enough hardware - I'll have to purchase more. So angry and disappointed. Don't bother with this bench!!!
customer_reviews.author: JoanieLI

customer_reviews.title: UNABLE TO ASSEMBLE
customer_reviews.text: This product is a great disappointment. It came on the date it was advised, but that is the only thing good that can be said about this bath bench. Not only does it NOT fit together but there is no return policy! My brother struggled for over two hours trying to get the parts and holes to line up and fit together. They most definitely did not. What he did get together, about four pieces, were as hard to take apart as they were to put together. And then to find out this product isn't eligible for return! DO NOT BUY THIS! If it were possible to leave no stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: Paula Glaser

customer_reviews.title: So SO happy I ordered THIS!
customer_reviews.text: This was something SUDDEN that my mom direly needed and these things are $100 at your local stores..for HALF the price we found this GEM and ordered it. Mom has a standard sized bathtub but was so worried it wouldn't fit. NOT ONLY did it fit but it was pretty easy to assemble! Thank goodness for the price AND this product...its sturdy and well made!
customer_reviews.author: LisaK

customer_reviews.title: Very strong and user friendly.
customer_reviews.text: Great item. My husband had a hip replacement. I ordered this and assembled it myself while he was still in rehab. It was a wonderful item to have at the house when he came home. I don't know how we would have managed without it. After a few months, he no longer needed it, so I bleached it and stored it. It's ready in case we need it again.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra C. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Needs Shims
customer_reviews.text: It took some doin' to put this together and once I did get it together and put it in the tub I had to put shims on the 2 legs that sit outside the tub. No amount of adjusting would make this fit so that the water wouldn't run outside the tub. I don't know if my tub is deeper than others or what but after I got it together, I wasn't going to take it apart, pack it up and ship it back; shims are cheaper and easier.
customer_reviews.author: Jan at the Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Just as described
customer_reviews.text: I didn't like this as well as I thought it would. I purchased it for my dad. I thought the wider base would make it more stable and two legs outside the tub would make it easier to get onto. I think that is true, but it doesn't make up for the difficulty in arranging the shower curtain so that the bathroom doesn't get flooded. Which not only creates a mess, but a real slip hazard on exiting the shower.
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly safe.
customer_reviews.text: When mobility is limited or climbing in and out of the bathtub is a challenge, a transfer bench that allows you to easily slide in and out of the tub is as easy and safe as they come. Water-resistant, non-corrosive with anti-slip materials, all ensures safety in the bathroom, especially for people with limited mobility. Huge bonus is how easy it is to assemble. No tools needed. Lightweight with durable aluminum frame. Long seat and backrest make more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: wynwat88

customer_reviews.title: the heights are off
customer_reviews.text: "So one set of legs goes in the tub and is on the shortest setting. The other set of legs go outside the tub on the bathroom floor. But they are not long enough so the whole thing tilts out of the tub. We are going to try to fix it with PCV. The outer set of legs are not long enough. Other wise I would have given it a 5 star. I tried using the seat with all legs in the tub and the tub is not wide enough or should I say the legs are too wide. I'm disappointed. Craftmanship is good just not a good fit for a trailer/mobile home sized tubs
customer_reviews.author: reneeholly

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT!!  LOVE IT..LIGHTWEIGHT TOO!
customer_reviews.text: I RECENTLY HAD KNEE REPLACEMENT SURGERY & MY HUSBAND PURCHASED THIS FOR ME!!! I LOVE IT! IT MAKES IT VERY EZ TO TRANSITION INTO TUB AREA & I HAVE A HAND SHOWER PIECE ATTACHED TO MY SHOWER HEAD & THIS WORKS GREAT. YOU JUST MUST BE CAREFUL TO PULL SHOWER CURTAIN & KIND OF SLIDE CURTIN UNDER YOU SO THE WATER DOES NOT GO ON THE FLOOR...BUT BE SURE TO ROLL A LG TOWEL ON FLOOR CLOSE TO TUB. IT WILL CATCH ANY WATER.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Giardenelli

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: Made it easy to get into the shower/tub. Make sure when you assemble it, that you do so taking in consideration which side of the shower you will need to enter in. A friend put this together for me and accidentally put it together the wrong way. However, another friend was able to fix it in about 10 minutes or less. I’d recommend this as it does what it says and is sturdy and allows for flexible adjustments.
customer_reviews.author: Scott J. Dan

customer_reviews.title: Worked for broken hip
customer_reviews.text: Broke my hip and wanted a way to bathe , this allowed me to shower with no problem, I was about to pay a contractor to take out my tub and build a stand in walk in shower. This transfer bench saved a lot of money and construction mess, and I still have my tub for times when I want a relaxing warm soak. I did end up taking off the back as I found it got in my way moving in and out of the tub. Other than that it worked fine.
customer_reviews.author: larry s

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, awkward assembly!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product one star because I wasn't allowed to give less than that (the rating it deserved). Assembling its components was a horrible experience! The tubular metal parts were not formed correctly and had to be forced into place to be attached. The only metal pieces that didn't have holes that had to be re-drilled were the supports for the seat back. I did get it assembled but as far as quality of its manufacture is concerned, it rates a DITY (Dumbest Idea This Year) award! I wouldn't buy one of these on a dare!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: it is just wide enough for inside of a bathtub, not to extend out for any significant and usable distance
customer_reviews.text: Ordered it for my 90 year-old mother in a different city, by time she found a worker to assemble it, the return was not possible, wanted to return it because it has arrived without the backrest like in the picture and because it is too narrow for a bathtub, for an old person it is hard to fit onto one side that hangs only a foot out and slide to the other side that hangs a foot in, but mainly because it has a backrest on the picture and not in the box.
customer_reviews.author: eugene spektor

customer_reviews.title: Missing Hardware
customer_reviews.text: I give this product a two star rating because four nuts were missing from the hardware package. This made it necessary for me to make a trip to the nearest hardware store. The bench itself is well-made. Perhaps the manufacturer needs to be aware of this problem, so it doesn’t happen to another Prime customer
customer_reviews.author: BillB

customer_reviews.title: Good bench, good price.
customer_reviews.text: Helps significantly with showering (in tub); I also use a leg bag to keep the bandages/cast dry. Quality is ok, it's sturdy, take your time assembling. I cut a rectangle out of the inner show curtain to accommodate, since part of the chair sits outside the tub, then use a towel on the side of the chair to keep water from flowing out through the gap.
customer_reviews.author: W. Bishop

customer_reviews.title: Worked well, fairly easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble. Only required pliers and a screw driver. It can be assemble with he seat on he left or right side. It is also very light. adjustable legs allow for the different height on the inside and outside of the tub. Worked well for us.
customer_reviews.author: digitalsavant

customer_reviews.title: A nightmare to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Took a long time to assemble. After trying to follow the picture only instructions by assembling the legs first the seats wouldn't line up with the holes so I took the legs apart and did the seats first which helped. The time spent and aggravation is not worth it. A year ago I bought a Medical Drive bench which was so easy to assemble! Unfortunately to fit inside my shower stall I had to with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Samuel A. Oganezov Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Kind of unstable
customer_reviews.text: This would be a good product if the screws would actually tighten. After tightening to a certain point it's almost impossible to get the nut to tighten any further, therefore the whole bench is kind of rickety. I don't know what the problem is but the manufacturers need to address this problem because anything destined for use by an infirm person should be doubly safe.
customer_reviews.author: slv

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this. It's a nightmare to put together and parts don't screw together properly
customer_reviews.text: This thing was a pain to put together. I put many items together often myself but this I gave up on. The bolts don't screw properly all the way onto the long screws and would have required two sets of hands and an electric screw driver to complete it. I would never this thing. I guess it's what you get when you order poorly designed stuff from China. I'm donating it.
customer_reviews.author: S. Davidson

customer_reviews.title: No suction on the suction cups.
customer_reviews.text: The suction cups on the legs do not form a good suction, it was sliding all over the place. The second problem is that my Mom's tub is a claw foot and the outer legs don't extend long enough for this to be used as intended. Does anyone know if there are longer adjustable leg options I could purchase separately? Several years ago I bought my Mom what I thought was this same chair but it must have been a different brand because the original chair I purchased had to be pried out of the tub to break the suction.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene Mouchette

customer_reviews.title: I doubt I would recommend it. Since it is already together and I ...
customer_reviews.text: We put this togther as per the instructions but it is akward in the tub and feels a little wobbly in the tub because the sides of the tub curve and there is no way to make this balance. My spouse had major surgery and weighs only 162 so he is way below the weight limit. I doubt I would recommend it. Since it is already together and I have no time to unassemble, I'll take a a$59 deduction and donate to charity. Perhaps someone has a larger tub. We will borrow a shower seat and eventually put in a regular walk in shower. It is as advertised but did work for us.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Meets needs.
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. The predrilled holes for the seat back angled terrible. It may have been me. Not sure if I had the bottom pieces backwards. But by then I was substantially complete with assembly and unwilling to take it all apart again. I left the back off. It will work for me like that but if you have a larger shower and the person using the bench needs that back support you may want to keep trying.
customer_reviews.author: becky warburton

customer_reviews.title: The best so far!
customer_reviews.text: I've used several kinds over the years and this one surpasses them all with flying coulours! The others used to rust terribly from the water and I would have to replace the parts like every few months if got expensive. But this one is better. The feet are made very well, there's no awful suction cups that are impossible to move. And the legs still stay in place it dosent move around. It's a great chair. I wish Medicaid would pay for good quality products like this but they only give you the cheek stuff. I would advise you to use your own money and buy this instead.
customer_reviews.author: The Abrahams

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY, COMPLETE GARBAGE!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hey Losers, your item did not fit together properly and now you wont accept my return??? The holes on this did not line up properly. I put these together for my patients and they usually come with push-pins only taking about 2-3 minutes to put together. This bench came with about 30 nuts and bolts, many of the holes did not line up for me to properly put this together. Now i cant send this crap back. Please somebody this is ROBBERY!!!
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Seat yourself naked on a cold seat!
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to get used to. Even with the legs on one side extended as far as they will go, and the others pushed in as far as they will (they aren't even in a slot), the whole chair tilts. I will have to get something safe to raise the feet on the outside. It's adequate for what it's made for, I just don't like having to use one.
customer_reviews.author: girluvsart

customer_reviews.title: Helps a lot but is a little unstable
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to help with bathing my disabled grandmother. It was pretty easy to assemble but doesn’t feel perfectly solid when in the shower and there is a slight angle when in the tub preventing it from sitting perfectly. It for sure helps in the shower but feels like it could for sure be more solid.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew H.

customer_reviews.title: Shower bench wasn't  safe
customer_reviews.text: Bench wasn't safe I weigh 189pds and as my aide sat me on the bench the legs to the bench bent and broke so I ended up on the floor of my shower had to be taken to the hospital so now Iost my bench because it broke and lost my money $55.99 because i know you won't give me my money back!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Marisel Rentas

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful value
customer_reviews.text: It’s a very good and sturdy bench. The price was amazing. I found the same bench elsewhere for twice as much. It’s also very comfortable. Love Amazon 🤗
customer_reviews.author: Diane Gude

customer_reviews.title: Causes water spills out of shower.
customer_reviews.text: We like the adjustable legs as the floor in shower is higher than the floor outside. Stable and strong enough. Update: It created a lot of problems as the shower curtain could not be in the shower resulting in a large water spill /mess in the bathroom. So we gave up on it, since there was no solution to the size. Switched to a simple stool.
customer_reviews.author: Clay Melugin

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I had knee replacement surgery 5 weeks ago and this shower chair has been a Godsend. Fits perfectly in my tub/shower combo. I cut the liner to fit into the slot on the seat and no water gets on the floor at all. I recommend this highly.
customer_reviews.author: JMarie

customer_reviews.title: If you buy this be prepared to rebuild and go to hardware store
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were very poorly written per the rehab nurse who put it together for us. She had put together others for patients and said this one had the poorest instructions she had ever seen. She had to take it apart and put it back together at least three times and didn’t have enough hardware to put the back of the seat on it so my husband just uses it without the back. Once she got it put together however it is sturdy (my husband is almost 300 pounds) and it holds him well and doesn’t wobble. It’s just the instructions weren’t clear and there wasn’t adequate hardware to put everything together.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for My Use
customer_reviews.text: Great design! I wanted one that sat in the tub and outside it, too. This one extends the entire width of my standard tub and leaves plenty of room to sit on the part outside the tub. It’s very sturdy and well made with large feet that stay put. The seat is comfortable and not slippery when wet.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Can Enter Bathtub Without Stepping Over
customer_reviews.text: My 91 year-old mother didn't want to try this, but now finds that she feels safer in the shower. She doesn't have to step over the tub edge, just sit down an swing her legs over. Can be adjusted for right or left. It is easy for someone to help her bathe also. For her, this is superior to stepping over the 5 inch edge of a walk-in shower to sit on a chair.
customer_reviews.author: NY Seattle

customer_reviews.title: It works ,it fits my Mom likes it.
customer_reviews.text: You only need 12 nuts. I "almost " freaked during assembly... until I read that part. You only need 12 nuts. ! The bench we received was perfect. Did what it was supposed to and fit perfectly. No complaints. Sturdy and fits well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t get this one!
customer_reviews.text: This was so hard to assemble, and we never really were able to tighten all the screws so it was wobbly. In the end it just went to the dumpster
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Total junk--DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: This shower bench is complete garbage. It came with incorrect screws (the ones provided are too long and if you screwed them in, as per the instructions, they would go through the top of the seat) and when you try to call the MedMobile help line, nobody picks up -- it a if, they are trying to clear inventory they know is bad (you can't return the bench). The company should be ashamed of themselves for trying to pawn off faulty inventory on a vulnerable population.
customer_reviews.author: GGH

customer_reviews.title: The replacement screws were not a good fit in length
customer_reviews.text: The assembly screws were color coded with paint to indicate as to where they were to be located. The paint on the screw threads prevented the nut to be assembled to the screw. The items were metric in dimension and the local hardware stores could not duplicate them. As a last resort I bought the closest size in American standard, opened the holes to fit , to complete the assembly. The replacement screws were not a good fit in length. I will have to buy plastic screw caps to prevent injury from their longer length.
customer_reviews.author: Terrence J. Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Lots of pieces and parts but the directions are great and I could put it together relatively easy
customer_reviews.text: Lots of pieces and parts but the directions are great and I could put it together relatively easy. My husband is a large guy over 6'4" and 225lbs and it is a sturdy enough to hold him safely in the shower. It fits over the standard tub nicely and remains safe for him.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: It should also be made of softer material(on the top) to be reasonably comfortable and wider from front to back
customer_reviews.text: Bathtub bench should be no higher than the tub's edge so the person can reach the bottom of tub and pickup the soap or other things that may fall. It should also be made of softer material(on the top) to be reasonably comfortable and wider from front to back.This chair is too tall, too narrow, too hard and the way it sticks out of tub water gets on the outside pad and pours out even with curtain. It comes disassembled with bolts/nuts/washers that are not made for curved pipe surfaces and they're hard to tighten. This chair would be OK for a taller person with healthy hands/legs who just doesn't like to stand under shower.
customer_reviews.author: Hesam H.

customer_reviews.title: The use and cost through Amazon purchase
customer_reviews.text: This bench was used during a dear friend rehabilitation at a Skilled Rehabilitation Center. We found this model to be the most effective bath chair during his rehabilitation, after an amputation of his right leg. The insurance company would not approve this model upon his discharge. Therefore I went to Amazon and searched for the same exact model. He was please with the price in comparison to the cost through a medical supply store. Thank you Amazon this has helped my friend gain his independency when bathing or showering. It allow him to transfer form his wheel chair or walker to the tub with ease. It is very durable and light weight. I would highly recommend this transfer bench/bath chair.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanell Boston

customer_reviews.title: Safe to sit on.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely needs some additional tools to put this together. Once together this is a very sturdy piece. I felt safe sitting on this chair.
customer_reviews.author: Ronda B.

customer_reviews.title: unsafe and eats up half a day to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Unable to get it sturdy and safe. After wasting my day I bought one that was easy to assemble, was safe and needed no tools. Nothing is a good price if you have to replace it to get a safe item.
customer_reviews.author: enerjoy

customer_reviews.title: It Works!
customer_reviews.text: Strong and stable and easy to use. You can let a pair of the legs sit outside the shower to help getting in if your shower isn't wide enough to accommodate the full width of the seat. (You can cut a cheap shower curtain to help keep the water in the shower.) Definite bonus is being able to mount the handle on either side of the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Elliet

customer_reviews.title: Nice seat for the price
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for my mom, to give her more stability in the tub and something else to hang on to. So far it has worked well. I wouldn't call it super heavy duty, but seems durable. Time will tell. Does take some time to assemble. Had to change things around a few times, but was not that difficult. Some folks might want to have some one else put it together for them. A number of nuts and bolts.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Killian

customer_reviews.title: quality
customer_reviews.text: good for the price ( but could have been less$. Was difficult to put together because screws did not align with holes,etc. Had to adapt. Took approx. 1 1/2 hrs to get together because of this.
customer_reviews.author: C. Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Watch out!
customer_reviews.text: The bench was not easy to assemble and the instructions were really difficult to follow. The biggest problem was missing components needs to build it properly. And the technical assistance phone line was incorrect. This item was purchased through a third party so Amazon was less than helpful. The representative suggested I could send the product back. What a joke! I suggested they more thoroughly check out third parties. Not a good idea to be selling assistive devices without all the proper components!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Duncan

customer_reviews.title: Bath tub assistance
customer_reviews.text: The bath tub transfer bench seat meets all expectations. My wife is recovering from a broken leg. During her rehabilitation weeks in a formal setting it was recommended that she get the bench seat to enable her to take a shower. It is ideal for transferring her from her walker to the bath tub where she is able to shower. The seat height is adjustable,is comfortable and certainly serves the purpose for which it is intended. My wife has been using the transfer bench seat for 10 days . I recommend that any one with similar problems while recuperating from an operation buy this bench seat.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Korea

customer_reviews.title: I usually like a challenge BUT
customer_reviews.text: These holes do not line up no matter how you position it. Frame is bent, wobbles from the get go. This was clearly a waste of money and I don't think it is refundable. Do yourself a favor and buy one that is already assembled some place.
customer_reviews.author: Susan C.

customer_reviews.title: Gets job done @ the end of the day
customer_reviews.text: Took me longer than i thought it would to assemble but i did it alone @ 70. I have to set it too far up towards faucets to get a level,sturdy resting place. Not worst think in the world but space is so limited in so. Fl.
customer_reviews.author: Allison m.

customer_reviews.title: Holes for screws in WRONG place!
customer_reviews.text: I WOULD NOT be able to recommend this item to anyone. I ordered it after breaking my leg and surgery. It came on time but when my husband went to put it together using its bag of bolts and screws he discovered that the holes in the rods were drilled in the wrong places. Thought about drilling more holes but knew that would compromise the durability of chair. Have tried numerous times over. Last 4 days to get through to number to call with NO success.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY...NOT A SAFE ITEM!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this!!!!! The screws they give go right through the seat. They will cut a person's backside. It says it's not returnable. We will see. Can not legally make people pay for faulty, broken items. Do not buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Wappan

customer_reviews.title: If You Need a Transfer Bench - This is It
customer_reviews.text: No one wants to own one of these - cause you know it means that someone in the household has significant mobility issues. But if you need one - this Transfer bench is easy to assemble, sturdy & slide proof. Yet it is also fairly lightweight, so even after a hip replacement, its user could turn it.
customer_reviews.author: Muse

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased after breaking both of my legs. It makes it very easy to transfer from the wheelchair to the bench since the bench extends outside the shower. The only complaint I could say was that the poles that the back is bolted to ended up breaking. I will admit that I am a large person approaching 300 pounds where the bench is only rated for 250 pounds. But I did not in any way apply that much weight against these supports. Regardless I contacted the vendor and requested that they send me some new back supports and they did so immediately at no charge without ant questions. Great customer service!!! Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Rodney Smith

customer_reviews.title: Definitely worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Without this, my wife wouldn’t be able to take a bath. The longer bench make getting in and out much easier.Wo
customer_reviews.author: Deon Unthank

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed as i dont have money to spend on things ...
customer_reviews.text: Cheap had to pound in screws as they did not line up with holes. Screw holes were also scratched up and gouged around holes. Missing 2 screws. Really disappointed as i dont have money to spend on things that are sub par
customer_reviews.author: dawnnoel

customer_reviews.title: Nice chair for the price
customer_reviews.text: This bench has been a lifesaver! After a knee injury this summer, we needed a shower chair. All the ones we had looked at were $150 and up. Being out of work for a month, we couldn't afford to pay that. This chair is sturdy, long, but doesn't seem to take up a lot of space. Also, the weight on this is 275 pounds. I didn't see it listed online, so if someone else needs to know. It doesn't arrive assembled. With a few tools, I was able to have this together in about 30 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: H. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble and light enough to maneuver....
customer_reviews.text: I am enjoying my new bench. Even if I wasn't temporarily disabled due to a medical procedure, I would still recommend this product for everyone. Much more convenient to shower. Safer too!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rocko3

customer_reviews.title: Purchased this chair for a knee replacement and just love it, It's sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this chair for a knee replacement and just love it, It's sturdy, rock solid and light weight. Assembly was easy and fast and the price was right. I should have saved the box for disassembly and storage. Hope I never need it again but in case I do I'm keeping it.
customer_reviews.author: Shotgun

customer_reviews.title: Versitile product
customer_reviews.text: Once put together this is a very nice and sturdy transfer seat. I recommend using a metric socket & ratchet drive to tighten the many nuts. It can be done with just an open end wrench but would take forever with much effort. as the nuts are of the friction locking type. A bonus is that it fits completely in a small shower stall as well.
customer_reviews.author: Larry K. Reddig

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to put together. Had to buy extra hardware to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Mary D.

customer_reviews.title: Very difficult for a handicapped senior to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: OMG, 100 pieces all separate. Some screws missing and two screws and locks did not work. Just got out of hospital and needed bench for home healthcare today. Very dissatisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Germaine  Mills

customer_reviews.title: Love it. With the legs that fit outside the ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my 93 year old mother. Love it. With the legs that fit outside the shower, it makes it very easy to transfer her into the shower. Did purchase the leg extensions to make it high enough to fit over the lip of the shower and make it easier for her.
customer_reviews.author: nanakat

customer_reviews.title: "This" is thee perfect Transfer bench
customer_reviews.text: Ah,,,, broken leg.. Non-weight baring for months....... "This" is thee perfect Transfer bench. Recommended by my PTs & Ots. Purchased before I left hospital, so it was ready when I go home. Others had no problems using the shower "with" the chair still in place. You just 'tuck' the shower curtain into the seat grove & TaDa,, no drips outside the tub. No mess. Easy to install too.
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Joint replacements best friend!
customer_reviews.text: I just had a hip replacement and this bench is perfect for bathing. Nice deep bench and very sturdy. I can easily take a shower by myself without fear of falling. I highly recommend this product to anyone that has a medical condition that prevents them from standing in the shower.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy to bathtub transfer bench
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, very sturdy and comfortable. Fits my tub perfectly! Since my accident I have not been able to stand in a shower, this is a god send! Thank you so very much for changing my life♥️
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Ann

customer_reviews.title: POOR QUALITY, HARD TO ASSEMBLE . DO NOT BUY!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was shocked to see how many parts this product came in. They was no way my older grandma could have assembled it. In fact I thought of returning it midway through the assembly because it was taking forever. Poor quality of the screws and washers (sharp edges). It was hard to align the holes to put in screws. Didn’t come with suction cups on the legs to secure inside the tub. Wouldn’t buy again.
customer_reviews.author: smita chavan

customer_reviews.title: Pretty tricky to put together
customer_reviews.text: Pretty tricky to put together. Some of the aluminum holes were not nice and round. I've put together many things I my life and this one, I didn't have the muscle to do myself. Both my husband in I had to put it together. But grandma seems happy so....
customer_reviews.author: Greta Weisman

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, spacious and easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This transfer bench/bath chair was exactly what my physical therapist had at the hospital where I had total hip replacement. My brother assembled it, and it was very sturdy and easy to adjust to our uneven floor/tub. He had my young daughter help him, and even she was able to follow instructions. Two months later, it is still holding up just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Seller didn’t return my call...
customer_reviews.text: Called the number - no one answers. We left 3 messages without a return call! The item description says the seat goes up to 20.5 inches. The tub is 20 inches, but the bench still rocks. We need a longer extension for the bench, please!!!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Reinhardt

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: TERRIFIC APPARATUS. HAD ANKLE REPLACEMENT AND NEEDED BACK SUPPORT. MUCH BETTER THAN STANDARD REGULAR ONE PANEL SEAT.
customer_reviews.author: SassySunshine

customer_reviews.title: I assembled myself!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to follow directions, I put it together in less than 45 minutes. You will need a Phillips head screwdriver and a wrench.... but otherwise, it's all there and then some! Nice looking, adjustable height and seems pretty sturdy. Definitely a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Lorri D.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, but so many screws
customer_reviews.text: I love this bench, it is what it says it is, sturdy, etc. but when I first opened the box, there were so many parts! haha , I just had my hubby do it!
customer_reviews.author: Christina W.

customer_reviews.title: Great transfer chair.
customer_reviews.text: NOTE: When ordering, please make sure you order the proper bench for your tub as you can have the side bar on the left or right. I required purchase of this item after my elderly Mom had taken a fall and she required State services for a few months. So, that process is very helpful in that these professionals know the better products on the market and can guide you, in detail, of what you need to make a loved one comfortable. To make life easier for them. This product is not that heavy and does not scratch the bottom of your tube. Easy to clean, as well. I'd definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: LML

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My wife is happy with the seat. You know what they say, Happy Wife, Happy Life. My wife is happy and that makes my life good.
customer_reviews.author: charles illingworth

customer_reviews.title: Crap
customer_reviews.text: Item arrives late and unable to return! beware. Now stuck with it even though it shipped later than advertised! Lame!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Bathtub Bench
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for my father after hip surgery. I started putting it together...........then my son completed it. One has to be careful when handling the metal tubing as the holes are a bit sharp. I ended up getting my palm sliced into because of the ragged sharp edges of the holes in the metal pieces. Looks fine after my son finished putting it together.
customer_reviews.author: micohawinds

customer_reviews.title: I would NOT recommend this product!
customer_reviews.text: This item was useless to us. One of the spring loaded buttons that are used for height adjustment was not there. When I went in to set up a return I found out that"this item not eligible for return". Assembly of the item was a nightmare only to find out on the last step of set up that the bench was worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Danny L. Clark

customer_reviews.title: easy to put together and adds a level off safety.
customer_reviews.text: Makes feel safe in the bath tub after I broke my Hip. I keep it in there because it is so convient to have a place to sit inside and outside the tub. Back and side rail can be installed on the other side as well.
customer_reviews.author: Laurel Williams

customer_reviews.title: Suits our needs.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my 75 year old grandmother, who had strokes and can no longer bathe on her own. The chair is sturdy, and sits perfectly over the edge of my tub, but it's lightweight enough to easily move out of the way when someone else needs the bath. She's able to sit down and slide over, which is perfect since she can't lift her legs over the edge of the tub anymore. The only issue we have is that there is some water getting on the floor, but that's really unavoidable when you need to have someone else in there helping.
customer_reviews.author: J. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: This is a great item.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item...probably influenced by the glorious shower it allowed me after 2 weeks without. A bit of a beast to put together... (lots of nuts and bolts.) Sturdy and easy to use... no good for folks without a curtain type shower. You do need a hand held shower to make this easy..I have a curtain shower and so was easy to prevent water on the floor... I have a fixed shower head but it still worked fine. Arm goes on either end.
customer_reviews.author: TeaLadyTeresa

customer_reviews.title: Works great to get into the tub/shower!
customer_reviews.text: These seats are fantastic for transferring into the bath/shower. You simply sit on the outside edge and then you can transfer your legs over the side of the tub using the handle to help. Once you are in the bathtub, the back on the chair helps a lot too. The only drawbacks are how to fix the shower curtain around the chair so it doesn't leak everywhere. I have been told that I need to cut my shower curtain to help with this issue but I cannot bring myself to do that. Also, you MUST have a hand held shower head in order to clean yourself everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Playful57

customer_reviews.title: Works for my Mother with mobility issues
customer_reviews.text: This was the correct product for my Mother to use to get into and out of the shower by herself. She is mobility challenged but wants to do this without assistance. Watching her try the bench (clothes on) and getting in and out of the tub indicates she will be glad she has it. The photo in the assembly instructions shows the handle and chair back on opposite end from each other. Remember the picture in the ad. Otherwise the assembly instructions were complete and relatively easy to follow. This does not appear to be for heavy individuals.
customer_reviews.author: C. Tate

customer_reviews.title: Great price, great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bench for my dad to use while visiting for the holiday. It was easy to assemble and worked great for him. Though our parents may not visit often, this will be good to have when they do. I can leave it in the shower and close the curtain, or store in closet or attic....(it does not fold up). Additionally, my dad is 6'4" and 280 lbs. The package says it holds 250 lbs...but it worked just fine for him.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Gray

customer_reviews.title: shower chair
customer_reviews.text: My sister just had a hip replacement and as usual I put off ordering the home supplies for her recovery until the last moment l went on Amazon and found exactly what I needed and had it in time for her hospital home coming. The box was very large and I was dreading opening it and putting together very pleasant surprise not one screw you just push in the holder with your finger slide on the legs and the holder snaps into place, and it let me make the legs that go into tub shorter to balance the height. Thank you I am more than happy with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Marcia

customer_reviews.title: I would def recommend this chair
customer_reviews.text: I would def recommend this chair. Nice and sturdy. easy to setup. would recommend laying a towel on the seat to prevent any possible slippage due to soap on the seat. Used daily in recovery from hip replacement
customer_reviews.author: P figs

customer_reviews.title: This works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this chair for my mother and had to borrow it for my own surgery. I have two suggestions. 1. Buy a cushion, it is hard, one that only covers the two inside panels, if it covers all 3 water runs off of it and out of the tub. I bought one and had to cut it down. 2. Cut your shower curtain to go in the first slot of the chair. Otherwise you will flood the bathroom. I have two curtains, I cut the inside curtain. This works like a charm. Good Luck.
customer_reviews.author: K. Chavers

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I am a home health therapist and have put together lots of bath benches. This one was very confusing and time consuming to put together. Worst of all, the thread piece was broken off inside the plastic seat so there was no way to attach the screw to the seat. I did not receive a satisfactory response to my complaint from the company but did receive a full refund from Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Ann H.

customer_reviews.title: You want this one
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for disabled mother(amputee). Originally unhappy with the mounting screws provided for the back attachment on the underside, they were too short. Called the company directly and asked if they could ship me some longer screws like the ones that held the legs together. They did no charge in two days. Since then no problems at all. Also very durable she puts a lot of weight on it trying to balance at times, still holding strong. I mean superior product, superior price and whats that superior customer service they earned a sixth star!
customer_reviews.author: Bargain Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Convenient
customer_reviews.text: Was as described....Worked perfect, convenient, light weight. But Back broke off after a few uses
customer_reviews.author: Alyson Damery-Ouellette

customer_reviews.title: Safe Shower Bench
customer_reviews.text: Excellent shower bench, family member needed new shower bench this was perfect. Great purchase
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not like picture
customer_reviews.text: This chair is sooo small. Picture is deceiving. Chair looks like it's for a child not an adult.
customer_reviews.author: mrsmae

customer_reviews.title: Great little unit at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Packaged very well and arrived quickly as do all my purchases from Amazon. Amazon web site picture does not show the addition of two suction cup style leg ends which may have been added later by the manufacturer to stabilize the unit in your shower or tub, these hold quite well. Although I purchased this for my wife who loves it, she is recovering from two broken ankles, I (about 200 lbs) used this as a step table to paint above our shower/tub without any problems at all (don't tell my wife though). Well worth the price! SilverFoxDan
customer_reviews.author: SilverFoxDan

customer_reviews.title: easily maneuverable box and required some assembly
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased for a family member living in an assisted living facility, so I can't give a very helpful review, but it arrived on time with Prime shipping, was packaged in a fairly flat, easily maneuverable box and required some assembly. My husband put it together in no time, and without complaints, but in all fairness, he is a mechanic. It seems to be working as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Wyo gadget cowgirl

customer_reviews.title: Easy assembly (simply button holes for the legs and the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works as intended for our less-than-100-pound relative. She doesn't have to climb over the ledge of the bathtub but instead wiggles over since the bench comes over the ledge. The back is reversible to accommodate whichever way your tub shower head is facing. The armrest is helpful to pull yourself over more towards the inside. Easy assembly (simply button holes for the legs and the backing).
customer_reviews.author: Maochung Lee

customer_reviews.title: Measure!
customer_reviews.text: Measure your soace carefully. Has to be far enough back in the tub to allow the user to lift legs in. That was a problem for me because after surgery I could not bend my leg well.
customer_reviews.author: CHS

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Too many pieces and the legs do not have the double holes to adjust. I'm a occupational therapist. Do not buy this one. Spend a few dollars more and get the one that is mostly put together or order from Walmart.com
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: MedMobile® Bathtub Transfer Bench/Bath Chair with Back, Wide SEAT, Adjustable SEAT Height, Sure-GRIPED Legs, Lightweight, Durable, Rust-Resistant Shower Bench
product_meta.description: THE ROUNDED END OF THE BENCH ALLOWS FOR EASIER AND MORE COMFORTABLE TRANSFER FROM THE WHEELCHAIR TO THE SHOWER. LEGS ARE MADE OF STURDY, RUSTPROOF ALUMINUM WITH WIDE FOOT GRIPS TO STABILIZE AND SECURE THE BENCH. THE TRANSFER BENCH IS MADE OF DURABLE, EASY TO CLEAN PLASTIC IN AN ATTRACTIVE WHITE COLOR. 250 LBS WEIGHT CAPACITY. 24" X 15" SEAT OFFERS EASY TRANSFER FROM WHEELCHAIR TO BATH SEAT. 5 LEVELS OF SEAT HEIGHT ADJUSTMENT, EACH INCREMENT IS 1". SEAT HEIGHT ADJUSTS FROM 16 1/2" TO 20 1/2". SEAT BACK CAN BE ASSEMBLED FOR LEFT OR RIGHT HAND APPLICATIONS. INSTALLATION OF BACKREST IS OPTIONAL. SURE-GRIP LEGS PROVIDE ADDED SAFETY AND STABILITY. THE OVERALL DIMENSION IS APPROXIMATELY 29”(L) X 16”(D) X 25”(H, WITHOUT BACKREST).
feature_bullets: 24" X 15" SEAT OFFERS EASY TRANSFER FROM WHEELCHAIR TO BATH SEAT.
5 LEVELS OF SEAT HEIGHT ADJUSTMENT, EACH INCREMENT IS 1".
HIGHLY FLEXIBLE, SEAT HEIGHT ADJUSTS FROM 16 1/2" TO 20 1/2".
SEAT BACK CAN BE ASSEMBLED FOR LEFT OR RIGHT HAND APPLICATIONS. INSTALLATION OF BACKREST IS OPTIONAL.
SURE-GRIP LEGS PROVIDE ADDED SAFETY AND STABILITY. THE OVERALL DIMENSION IS APPROXIMATELY 29”(L) X 16”(D) X 25”(H, WITHOUT BACKREST).

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}

categories: Bath & Shower Safety Seating & Transfer Benches
